item.description:
22nd annual Sheep Shearing Festival at Gore Place, Waltham

Who would have thunkit, a farm festival right in the city!


http://www.goreplace....
www.goreplace/sheepshearing-press-photos.htm



Don't Miss This Wonderful
FARM FESTIVAL for the WHOLE FAMILY!
Taking place over several acres of the governor Gore estate, the annual Sheepshearing Festival has long been a New England tradition. There will be all sorts of activities and demonstrations to enjoy, lively music, dancers, performers, historic recreators, farm animals, wagon rides, magic shows and a large crafts fair. There will be plenty of food vendors onsite as well.
And, best of all, admission is free for children 12 & under (Adults $10). Parking is also free.
 sheep shearing
 herding dogs demonstration
 spinning and weaving
 large crafts fair
 music
 magic shows!
 farm animals
 free parking
 food vendors on site
 sorry, no dogs allowed
DIRECTiONS: Gore Place is located at 52 Gore Street in Waltham, Massachusetts just off Route 20.
From I-90 (Mass Pike) take exit 17 to Watertown Square. Turn left onto Route 20 (Main Street). Travel 1~1/4 miles to Gore Street. From Route 128/I-95 exit 26 to Route 20 east (Main Street) 3~1/2 miles to Gore Street. See map.
For more information call: (781) 894-2798.
item.name: 22nd annual Sheep Shearing Festival at Gore Place, Waltham
